questions.questionText:
Statement: All doctors are professionals. 

Conclusions:
I. Some professionals are doctors.
II. All professionals are doctors.

Which conclusion(s) follow?
questions.explanation: From 'All doctors are professionals': Conclusion I 'Some professionals are doctors' follows because those doctors are professionals. Conclusion II 'All professionals are doctors' does not follow because there can be other professionals. Answer: Only I.

questions.questionText:
Statement: Some engineers are creative.

Conclusions:
I. Some creative people are engineers.
II. All engineers are creative.

Which conclusion(s) follow?
questions.explanation: From 'Some engineers are creative': Conclusion I 'Some creative people are engineers' follows (conversion of particular statement). Conclusion II 'All engineers are creative' does not follow because 'some' does not mean 'all'. Answer: Only I.

questions.questionText:
Statements:
1. All books are papers.
2. All papers are notes.

Conclusions:
I. All books are notes.
II. Some notes are books.

Which conclusion(s) follow?
questions.explanation: From the chain: All books→papers→notes, we get All books are notes (Conclusion I follows). Also, since all books are notes, some notes must be books (those books) (Conclusion II follows). Answer: Both I and II.
